lines.text: We are missionaries. The province sent us here to fight evil, not flee from it.
Will you allow me to take little Ching-Ching out of harm's way?
Barbara will remain here with us. And I wish you would not refer to her as Ching-Ching.
Mr. Kruikshank, you may do as you wish with your own life, but Ching - Barbara is a child. Her honorable parents were my friends.
I know. But they did not desert their posts when danger threatened.
No, and they were killed.
Please, Alfred.
I have decided.
You've been so nice to me, I'd like to buy you something. What would you like?
A soup bone.
A what?
A soup bone. For my dog. He's awful hungry.
Do you think your mother would mind if you joined us in a soup bone?
I haven't got any mother.
Well, then, your father, or family?
I haven't any family. I haven't even got Chang.
Who's Chang?
He brought me here from Sanchow, and then he ran away with my money.
We found the stowaway, sir.
Well, where is he? Let me at him.
It's not a he, sir.
It's this child here.
What, you?
I guess so.
She doesn't even know how she got aboard, sir.
Well, what am I going to do with you?
I'll look after her.
Susan, don't be absurd!
Well, that's fine, Miss Parker. Bring her up to my quarters later, and we'll see that she's returned to her people. See you later, stowaway!
I hope you will always remember the sayings of our wise men.
I will, because you taught them to me.
It was an honor to instruct the child of my friends, your honorable father and mother.
Friendship is like a shelter from the rains of trouble.

And so it is my wish to protect you from trouble that may be here very soon. Bad men are on their way here. There will be looting and destruction. I have arranged for Chang to take you to the home of my honorable brother in Shanghai.
Shanghai? Oh, that's wonderful! I remember all the stories my daddy used to tell me about it.
Mind you, he was only twelve! Richard spoke up as quick as a flash, and what do you think he said?
He said, "You may use my bicycle, Geraldine. I love sports, but I love the principles of manhood more."
I'm afraid I'm boring you.
I'm sorry, Mrs. Hope, but Richard told me that story the first three times you told it to me...

I tell it not because Richard is my son, but because I thought you, as his future wife, might be interested. Obviously I was mistaken, but mark my words, the time will come when you'll be just as devoted to Richard...
I am devoted to him, only...
Only you have a peculiar way of demonstrating your devotion!
What did you mean when you said you didn't know how you got aboard this ship? You must know!
But I don't. The last thing I remember is I fell asleep in Uncle Tommy's car.
Tommy who?
Randall. Tommy Randall.
Tommy Randall? Why, your Uncle Tommy is on board this ship!
I might've known you were his niece. He's a problem child, too.
I'll take you to him.
Considering his reputation, you'd better turn her over to the Captain.
There's a young lady to see you, sir, I think it's rather urgent.
Oh, that's bad.
She's very beautiful, sir.
Oh? That's not so bad.
She has a child with her, sir.
Oh, that is bad.
She also has the captain with her, and he insists upon seeing you, sir.
Oh, that's very bad!
Here you are, sir?
What's that?
Your checkbook, sir.
I don't know what your game is, young lady, but it won't work! I've never seen you before in my life, and besides I have witnesses to account for my whereabouts for the past twenty-seven years!
Mr. Randall!
Uncle Tommy!
Ching-Ching!
This is Susan Parker, my best friend. He's my best friend, too. Don't you think she's extravagant?
She's magnificent.
Thank you. Charming little niece you have there.
I'm not really his niece, Susan. I'm just pretending.
Mr. Randall, aren't you the child's uncle?
No, we met in Shanghai yesterday for the first time.
Moonlight on the water, stars in the sky, slow music, it's almost overdone, isn't it? They might've at least omitted the music.
Everything's here, including you and me. Taken all together, that spells romance.
Romance takes two.
There are two here.
Yes, but not the right two. You see, I'm engaged. To Richard Hope, Mrs. Hope's son. He's meeting the boat in Bangkok. We're to be married there.
Why Bangkok?
Well, he lives there. He with an exporting firm.
Exporting what?
Oh, ivory, apes, peacocks - that sort of thing. He came out here two years ago, and he's worked very hard.
You mean you've been engaged for two years, and you haven't seen him in all that time? Oh, you Latins, what a hot-blooded race you are.
Richard isn't quite like that. Besides, we've known each other since we were children.
Well, I must say it all sounds rather lyrical.
It may not be exactly lyrical.
Me, I've never been engaged, not definitely, that is, but if I were ...
"Millionaire Playboy Sued for Breech of Promise."
Oh, I practically won that case. She only got ten thousand dollars. Poor kid, she'd been counting on fifty.
Ten thousand dollars? That's more than Richard makes in a year.
Why did you cable me? Where's Susan? She's not ill, is she?
No, Richard, she's not ill.
Then why did you cable me? It's not exactly an inexpensive trip.
I know, Richard, I know, but frankly the situation was more than I could bare alone.
Heavens, Mother, don't build it up!
Have you ever heard of a Tommy Randall?
It sounds familiar.
It should be, it's been in the papers often enough. Well, he's on this boat!
What's that got to do with Susan?
Richard, your mother is a woman of the world, and she can tell ...
She can tell what? Heavens, Mother, we're not getting anywhere.
I'm not saying there's anything wrong between them ...
Oh, so that's it. You mean I've flown here just to be told that Susan's having a harmless little ship flirtation?
It may be harmless and it may be not. Susan is a very headstrong young woman.
Well, marriage will straighten her out.
Richard! This is a surprise!
It's a surprise for me, too.
Oh, uh, Richard, this is Mr. Randall, and this is Miss Ching-Ching Stewart. I never thought I'd see you here.
Evidently not.
Weren't you surprised to see him here?
Hardly. I sent for him.
Marvelous. I love surprises, and I hardly ever get them.
Susan, I think your friends will excuse you.
Oh, Tommy, I must be going. You'll look after Ching-Ching, won't you?
She'll be perfectly fine.

[leaving]
Goodbye, darling.
Goodbye, Aunt Susan. You like Susan, don't you, Uncle Tommy?
You could call it that.
I don't see how anyone could have fun with that Mr. Hope.
I'm afraid fun isn't everything, Ching-Ching.
Susan, close your eyes and put out your hand. I have something for you.
Susan! Where did that come from?
From Uncle Tommy.
Who?
Well, I asked him not to buy it.
Look, he bought me a bracelet, too.
That must have cost...
Three hundred dollars. I saw the price tag.
He wouldn't have spent that much money if he didn't think you were interested in him.
I don't think I'm even going to answer that.
Of course, you'll return it, won't you, Susan?
Do you know where Ching-Ching is?
Yes.
Well, would you mind telling me?
She's below, getting ready to leave the ship at the next stop. They're sending her to an orphanage for girls. She'll be marching in lockstep and eating gruel within a week. I hope you like it!
Surely something can be done. That can't happen to Ching-Ching.
Wait a minute, I've got an idea. You're going to marry old sourpuss, aren't you?
I beg your pardon!
I'm sorry, no offense meant. Look, I wanted to adopt Ching-Ching, but they won't let me because I'm unmarried. But you're getting married, you can adopt her.
But Richard and I...

[shouting]
You don't want her to go to an instituion, do you?

[shouting]
Of course not!

Look, I've gone completely soft about this kid. I know it's hard to believe, but true. Won't you please take her and let me pay for her upbringing until I can take her myself? That'll be as quick as I can get to the States and come back with a wife. You may not believe it, but there are quite a few women back home who'd be willing to marry me. Look, it's not for me, it's for Ching-Ching! Won't you please do it?
All right, I'll do it.
Richard, I want to adopt little Ching-Ching as soon as we're married.
What?
Whoever heard of such a thing!
But if I don't, they'll put her in an institution!
Well, that's what institutions are for.
I'm sure Richard doesn't want to start his married life with a ready-made family, especially with a child called Ching-Ching!
But it won't be for long, just until Mr. Randall gets back. You see, it's a favor to him. He wants to adopt her as soon as he can, and as soon as he gets married, he'll arrange to take her.
Why should I do Mr. Randall a favor?
But it isn't for him, it's for the little girl. Think of her future!
Don't meddle with other people's destinies. Forget about this child! She got along before she met you, and she can get along after she leaves you. Dismiss her from your mind completely!
Don't you think Richard and I should settle this by ourselves? After all, it concerns us.
Anything that concerns Richard concerns me!
I think Mother is right.
Your mother's right, and I'm wrong?
Yes. That is, I think you're mistaken.
So do I. I've been mistaken about us. A marriage is for two people. I'm calling off our engagement.

Look, I know exactly what you think of me, but that's not important now. Hear me out. Marry me! Please don't misunderstand me. You wouldn't have to put up with me. It'll be a marriage in name only. As soon as we dock in San Francisco, we'll go right to Reno and get a divorce. My lawyers will take care of everything. Please, won't you do it? It's the only way.
Would you really do that for her?
I'd do anything in the world for her.
So would I.
Are you really and truly my parents now?
We're the only parents you've got, darling.
Sun Lo says a child without parents is like a ship without a rudder.
One never knows, does one, when love will come along?
Now, Ching-Ching, have either of the parties ever evidenced by their actions any proper legal grounds for divorce?
There is utterly no grounds for disturbing the marital status of the contestants.
This is most irregular, your honor. The child clearly doesn't know what she's saying!
Oh yes, she does! Isn't this entire divorce case just the result of two adults behaving like stubborn children, refusing to break down and admit that they're in love with each other?
To be with the one you love is better for your health than medicine.
That sounds like a Chinese proverb.
Oh, Judge, you haven't heard anything yet.

[to Shirley Temple]
May your shadow lengthen always in the sun of happiness.
